DataElement.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Single Agent Systemic Chemotherapy Immunotherapy Therapy Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator that asks whether the patient/participant received single-agent noninvestigational systemic chemotherapy or immunotherapy for the treatment of Kaposi Sarcoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Single Agent Systemic Chemotherapy Immunotherapy Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to  Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) and treatment with single-agent systemic chemotherapy or immunotherapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin however, it may also occur internally.  It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).

Property.preferredName: Single Agent Systemic Chemotherapy Immunotherapy Therapy
Property.preferredDefinition: Systemic chemotherapy with a single agent regimen.  A regimen is described as a distinctive collection of agent(s) and/or modalities to be utilized together during a cycle or course of therapy.  All routes of administration are acceptable as long as the agent is intended for systemic therapy.:(IM-yoo-no-THER-a-pee) Treatment to stimulate or restore the ability of the immune system to fight infections and other diseases. Also used to lessen side effects that may be caused by some cancer treatments.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Systemic chemotherapy with a single agent regimen. All routes of administration are acceptable as long as the agent is intended for systemic therapy.
Therapy designed to induce changes in a patient's immune status in order to treat disease.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the participant received
